refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A collection of utility functions for working SSIDs, IP addresses, WiFi access points and devices, among other things.

refsect2.title: nm_print_backtrace()
refsect2.para: Prints a backtrace of the calling process to the logging location.

listitem.simpara: location in which to place the current timestamp

refsect2.title: nm_utils_init ()
refsect2.para: Initializes libnm-util; should be called when starting and program that uses libnm-util. Sets up an atexit() handler to ensure de-initialization is performed, but calling nm_utils_deinit() to explicitly deinitialize libnm-util can also be done. This function can be called more than once.

listitem.simpara: location to store error, or NULL
TRUE if the initialization was successful, FALSE on failure.

refsect2.title: nm_utils_deinit ()
refsect2.para: Different manufacturers use different mechanisms for not broadcasting the AP's SSID. This function attempts to detect blank/empty SSIDs using a number of known SSID-cloaking methods.

listitem.simpara: pointer to a buffer containing the SSID data
length of the SSID data in ssid
TRUE if the SSID is "empty", FALSE if it is not

refsect2.title: nm_utils_escape_ssid ()
refsect2.programlisting: const char* nm_utils_escape_ssid (const guint8 *ssid, guint32 len);
refsect2.para: This function does a quick printable character conversion of the SSID, simply replacing embedded NULLs and non-printable characters with the hexadecimal representation of that character. Intended for debugging only, should not be used for display of SSIDs.

listitem.simpara: pointer to a buffer containing the SSID data
length of the SSID data in ssid
pointer to the escaped SSID, which uses an internal static buffer and will be overwritten by subsequent calls to this function

refsect2.title: nm_utils_same_ssid ()
refsect2.para: Earlier versions of the Linux kernel added a NULL byte to the end of the SSID to enable easy printing of the SSID on the console or in a terminal, but this behavior was problematic (SSIDs are simply byte arrays, not strings) and thus was changed. This function compensates for that behavior at the cost of some compatibility with odd SSIDs that may legitimately have trailing NULLs, even though that is functionally pointless.

listitem.simpara: first SSID data to compare
second SSID data to compare
TRUE to ignore one trailing NULL byte
TRUE if the SSIDs are the same, FALSE if they are not

refsect2.title: nm_utils_ssid_to_utf8 ()
refsect2.para: WiFi SSIDs are byte arrays, they are _not_ strings. Thus, an SSID may contain embedded NULLs and other unprintable characters. Often it is useful to print the SSID out for debugging purposes, but that should be the _only_ use of this function. Do not use this function for any persistent storage of the SSID, since the printable SSID returned from this function cannot be converted back into the real SSID of the access point.
This function does almost everything humanly possible to convert the input into a printable UTF-8 string, using roughly the following procedure:

1) if the input data is already UTF-8 safe, no conversion is performed 2) attempts to get the current system language from the LANG environment variable, and depending on the language, uses a table of alternative encodings to try. For example, if LANG=hu_HU, the table may first try the ISO-8859-2 encoding, and if that fails, try the Windows-1250 encoding. If all fallback encodings fail, replaces non-UTF-8 characters with '?'. 3) If the system language was unable to be determined, falls back to the ISO-8859-1 encoding, then to the Windows-1251 encoding. 4) If step 3 fails, replaces non-UTF-8 characters with '?'.
Again, this function should be used for debugging and display purposes _only_.

listitem.simpara: pointer to a buffer containing the SSID data
length of the SSID data in ssid
an allocated string containing a UTF-8 representation of the SSID, which must be freed by the caller using g_free(). Returns NULL on errors.

refsect2.title: nm_utils_gvalue_hash_dup ()
refsect2.para: Utility function to duplicate a hash table of GValues.

listitem.simpara: a GHashTable mapping string:GValue
a newly allocated duplicated GHashTable, caller must free the returned hash with g_hash_table_unref() or g_hash_table_destroy()

refsect2.title: nm_utils_slist_free ()
refsect2.para: Utility function to free a GSList.

listitem.simpara: a GSList
user function called for each element in list

refsect2.title: enum NMUtilsSecurityType
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { NMU_SEC_INVALID = 0, NMU_SEC_NONE, NMU_SEC_STATIC_WEP, NMU_SEC_LEAP, NMU_SEC_DYNAMIC_WEP, NMU_SEC_WPA_PSK, NMU_SEC_WPA_ENTERPRISE, NMU_SEC_WPA2_PSK, NMU_SEC_WPA2_ENTERPRISE } NMUtilsSecurityType;

refsect2.title: nm_utils_security_valid ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean nm_utils_security_valid (NMUtilsSecurityType type, guint32 wifi_caps, gboolean have_ap, gboolean adhoc, guint32 ap_flags, guint32 ap_wpa, guint32 ap_rsn);
refsect2.para: Given a set of device capabilities, and a desired security type to check against, determines whether the combination of device, desired security type, and AP capabilities intersect.

listitem.simpara: the security type to check AP flags and device capabilties against, e.g. NMU_SEC_STATIC_WEP
bitfield of the capabilities of the specific WiFi device, e.g. NM_WIFI_DEVICE_CAP_CIPHER_WEP40
whether the ap_flags, ap_wpa, and ap_rsn arguments are valid
whether the capabilities being tested are from an Ad-Hoc AP (IBSS)
bitfield of AP capabilities, e.g. NM_802_11_AP_FLAGS_PRIVACY
bitfield of AP capabilties derived from the AP's WPA beacon, e.g. (NM_802_11_AP_SEC_PAIR_TKIP | NM_802_11_AP_SEC_KEY_MGMT_PSK)
bitfield of AP capabilties derived from the AP's RSN/WPA2 beacon, e.g. (NM_802_11_AP_SEC_PAIR_CCMP | NM_802_11_AP_SEC_PAIR_TKIP)
TRUE if the device capabilities and AP capabilties intersect and are compatible with the desired type, FALSE if they are not

refsect2.title: nm_utils_ip4_addresses_from_gvalue ()
refsect2.para: Utility function to convert a GPtrArray of GArrays of guint32s representing a list of NetworkManager IPv4 addresses (which is a tuple of address, gateway, and prefix) into a GSList of NMIP4Address objects. The specific format of this serialization is not guaranteed to be stable and the GArray may be extended in the future.

listitem.simpara: gvalue containing a GPtrArray of GArrays of guint32s
a newly allocated GSList of NMIP4Address objects

refsect2.title: nm_utils_ip4_addresses_to_gvalue ()
refsect2.para: Utility function to convert a GSList of NMIP4Address objects into a GPtrArray of GArrays of guint32s representing a list of NetworkManager IPv4 addresses (which is a tuple of address, gateway, and prefix). The specific format of this serialization is not guaranteed to be stable and may be extended in the future.

listitem.simpara: a list of NMIP4Address objects
a pointer to a GValue into which to place the converted addresses, which should be unset by the caller (when no longer needed) with g_value_unset().

refsect2.title: nm_utils_ip4_routes_from_gvalue ()
refsect2.para: Utility function to convert a GPtrArray of GArrays of guint32s representing a list of NetworkManager IPv4 routes (which is a tuple of route, next hop, prefix, and metric) into a GSList of NMIP4Route objects. The specific format of this serialization is not guaranteed to be stable and may be extended in the future.

listitem.simpara: gvalue containing a GPtrArray of GArrays of guint32s
a newly allocated GSList of NMIP4Route objects

refsect2.title: nm_utils_ip4_routes_to_gvalue ()
refsect2.para: Utility function to convert a GSList of NMIP4Route objects into a GPtrArray of GArrays of guint32s representing a list of NetworkManager IPv4 routes (which is a tuple of route, next hop, prefix, and metric). The specific format of this serialization is not guaranteed to be stable and may be extended in the future.

listitem.simpara: a list of NMIP4Route objects
a pointer to a GValue into which to place the converted routes, which should be unset by the caller (when no longer needed) with g_value_unset().
an IPv4 netmask in network byte order
the CIDR prefix represented by the netmask
a CIDR prefix
the netmask represented by the prefix
a newly allocated UUID suitable for use as the NMSettingConnection object's "id:" property. Should be freed with g_free()

refsect2.title: nm_utils_uuid_generate_from_string ()
refsect2.para: For a given s, this function will always return the same UUID.

listitem.simpara: a string to use as the seed for the UUID
a newly allocated UUID suitable for use as the NMSettingConnection object's "id:" property
